summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-second Avenue, from East Cherry Street to East Terrace Street; and East Terrace Street, from Twentieth Avenue to Twenty-third Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same and constructing concrete sidewalks thereon, in accordance with Resolution No. 198 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
